newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malakoff to build co-generation plant.
newsitem.headline: Malakoff to build co-generation plant.

text.p: Malaysia's Malakoff Bhd said on Friday it has accepted an offer to provide a co-generation plant to supply power and steam requirements to Malaysian Newsprint Industries Sdn Bhd (MNI).

The company said in a statement that the agreement with MNI, which is constructing a paper mill in central Pahang state, would be for an initial period of 20 years from a commercial operations date and might be extended for two additional periods of five years each.
"The project is viewed as a natural development for the company after the successful completion of its Lumut power plant," it said.

MNI is a joint venture between three local companies -- New Straits Times Press Malaysia Bhd (30 percent), the Hong Leong group (30 percent), Rimbunan Hijau group (20 percent) -- and New Zealand's Fletcher Challenge (20 percent).
